{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine which drug is not used for medical management of ectopic pregnancy, we need to refer to the relevant documents. Document [0] states that methotrexate is the drug most frequently used for medical management of ectopic pregnancy. It also mentions that other agents studied for this purpose include potassium chloride, hyperosmolar glucose, prostaglandins, and RU-486. However, it states that these other agents are not recommended for the treatment of ectopic pregnancy because their safety and efficacy are not well documented. Therefore, the drug that is not used for medical management of ectopic pregnancy is potassium chloride. ", "answer_choice": "A"}
